intro: Verbascum inulifolium, commonly known as the woolly mullein, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late summer, which are clustered in a raceme at the top of the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Verbascum inulifolium is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat respiratory ailments.
